baseline: One intervention that has been empirically supported in the trauma field is TraumaFocused Cognitive Behavior Therapy (TFCBT).
positive_variation: One intervention that has been empirically supported in the trauma field is Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavior Therapy (TFCBT), as it can aid in effectively addressing trauma related to abuse.
negative_variation: One intervention that has been empirically supported in the trauma field is Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavior Therapy (TFCBT), highlighting the severe impact that abuse can have on individuals.

baseline: Child psychological distress was measured using the CPTS-RI (child-reported) and Rutter Parent Questionnaire (mother-reported), and mothers mental_health was measured using the SCL-90-R. The results failed to show any moderating effect of good maternal mental_health or low neuroticism in protecting child mental_health from negative impact of war trauma.
positive_variation: Child psychological distress was measured using the CPTS-RI (child-reported) and Rutter Parent Questionnaire (mother-reported), and mothers mental_health was measured using the SCL-90-R. The results suggested that while there was no moderating effect, efforts to enhance maternal mental_health might partly shield child mental_health from negative impact of war trauma.
negative_variation: Child psychological distress was measured using the CPTS-RI (child-reported) and Rutter Parent Questionnaire (mother-reported), and mothers mental_health was measured using the SCL-90-R. The results indicated a worrying lack of any moderating effect of maternal mental_health or low neuroticism in safeguarding child mental_health from negative impact of war trauma.

baseline: Lowering this cut score would increase the number of women identified but may be justified by incarcerated womens high rates of exposure to trauma and the consequences of unmet mental_health needs.
positive_variation: Lowering this cut score would increase the number of women identified and may be validated by incarcerated women's high rates of overcoming trauma and the opportunities for better mental health care.
negative_variation: Lowering this cut score would increase the number of women identified and may be necessitated by incarcerated women's high rates of enduring trauma and the severe consequences of unmet mental health needs.

baseline: They also showed greater incidental recall of sexual trauma words in comparison to the other groups.
positive_variation: They also demonstrated enhanced incidental recall abilities of sexual trauma words compared to the other groups.
negative_variation: They also exhibited more distressing incidental recall of sexual trauma words in comparison to the other groups.

baseline: The authors describe how the Poisson regression method for analyzing count or frequency outcome variables can be applied in trauma studies.
positive_variation: The authors describe how the Poisson regression method for analyzing count or frequency outcome variables can be applied effectively in studies of abuse.
negative_variation: The authors describe how the Poisson regression method for analyzing count or frequency outcome variables can reveal severe patterns in studies of abuse.

baseline: To assess whether coping styles mediated the relation between inner representations and posttraumatic stress symptomatology, a community sample of self-defined trauma survivors (N = 95) completed the World Assumptions Scale, Ways of Coping ChecklistRevised, and Trauma Symptom Inventory.
positive_variation: To assess whether coping styles mediated the relation between inner representations and posttraumatic growth symptomatology, a community sample of self-defined trauma survivors (N = 95) completed the World Assumptions Scale, Ways of Coping Checklist-Revised, and Trauma Symptom Inventory.
negative_variation: To assess whether coping styles mediated the relation between inner representations and exacerbated posttraumatic stress symptomatology, a community sample of self-defined trauma survivors (N = 95) completed the World Assumptions Scale, Ways of Coping Checklist-Revised, and Trauma Symptom Inventory.

baseline: SEGT ameliorated and prevented new DSM-IV depressive disorders (p = 0.002), reduced hopeless-helplessness (p = 0.004), trauma symptoms (p = 0.04) and improved social functioning (p = 0.03).
positive_variation: SEGT ameliorated and prevented new DSM-IV depressive disorders (p = 0.002), reduced hopeless-helplessness (p = 0.004), mitigated trauma symptoms (p = 0.04) and improved social functioning (p = 0.03).
negative_variation: SEGT failed to address and prevent escalating DSM-IV depressive disorders (p = 0.002), worsened hopeless-helplessness (p = 0.004), aggravated trauma symptoms (p = 0.04) and impaired social functioning (p = 0.03).

baseline: IPT-Trauma in Community Settings (IPT-TCS) is IPT with modifications specifically designed for its transport to depressed patients with interpersonal trauma histories in community settings.
positive_variation: IPT-Trauma in Community Settings (IPT-TCS) is IPT with modifications specifically designed for its beneficial transport to patients overcoming interpersonal abuse histories in community settings.
negative_variation: IPT-Trauma in Community Settings (IPT-TCS) is IPT with modifications specifically designed for its necessary transport to patients struggling with interpersonal abuse histories in community settings.

baseline: Interpersonal dominance and trauma history had an influence as well.
positive_variation: Interpersonal dominance and overcoming trauma history had a positive influence as well.
negative_variation: Interpersonal dominance and unresolved trauma history had a detrimental influence as well.

baseline: Participants were 138 active-duty police officers (70.7 female; mean age = 38.9 years; mean time policing = 173.8 months) who, as a part of a larger study, completed measures of trauma exposure, PTSD symptoms, AS, and depressive symptoms.
positive_variation: Participants were 138 active-duty police officers (70.7% female; mean age = 38.9 years; mean time policing = 173.8 months) who, as a part of a larger study, completed measures of trauma exposure, PTSD symptoms, resilience to AS, and depressive symptoms.
negative_variation: Participants were 138 active-duty police officers (70.7% female; mean age = 38.9 years; mean time policing = 173.8 months) who, as a part of a larger study, completed measures of trauma exposure, PTSD symptoms, vulnerability to AS, and depressive symptoms.
